intro: Cissampelos parmata, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitats.
